title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
00:04 <vmassol> has quit  
00:07 <bbc581> has joined #xwiki

00:28 <Enygma`> has quit  
00:46 <jstoldt> has joined #xwiki

01:00 <hacker> has joined #xwiki  
01:01 <hacker> is now known as <Guest37140>  
01:02 <Guest37140> is now known as <sdumitriu>  
01:04 <@sdumitriu> cjdelisle: There's a script service for parsing XML, so it can be done without Groovy  
01:05 <+cjdelisle> there is a lot I don't know about  
01:06 <+cjdelisle> wdyt of my proposed solution to XWIKI-6170?  
01:07 <@sdumitriu> Didn't read it yet thoroughly, but +0 for the moment  
01:09 <+cjdelisle> I went back and forth on it for a while but I decided that extra complexity in the cache is better if it means the cache will function properly nomatter how bad the code around it behaves.  
01:10 <+cjdelisle> Same reason for using bencoding for 6169

08:44 <qwebirc95081> hello  
08:45 <qwebirc95081> has quit  
08:50 <+tmortagne> vmassol: shouldn't we start moving to maven 3 on ci.xwiki.org ?  
08:50 <+tmortagne> (and good morning)  
08:50 <vmassol> tmortagne: good morning  
08:51 <vmassol> it depends if we want to continue supporting maven 2.2.x  
08:51 <vmassol> if so then it's best that ci.xwiki.org stays on 2.2.x  
08:51 <vmassol> to prove it still works  
08:51 <vmassol> or have several agents  
08:51 <+tmortagne> I would say we don't really care IMO, it's not like 3.0 was a beta  
08:51 <vmassol> one on 2.2.X and anotrher on 3.x  
08:51 <vmassol> I'm fine if we decide to support only 3.x from now on  
08:51 <+tmortagne> noone is forced to stay on 2.2 so we should not have to support it IMO  
08:51 <vmassol> probably requires a vote  
08:52 <+tmortagne> probably  
08:52 <+tmortagne> sending it  
08:55 <+tmortagne> vmassol: maven 3 does not require java 6 right ? (trying to search on the website)  
08:55 <vmassol> I think that's correct  
08:55 <vmassol> but not sure  
08:55 <+tmortagne> ansswering to myself, actually i'm using java 5 :)  
08:55 <vmassol> haha  
08:58 <mflorea> has quit  
08:59 <vmassol> nice sonar guys have added commons/rendering as I had asked them: http://nemo.sonarsource.org/components/index/178313  
09:00 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:01 <+tmortagne> who change XEM configuration from hsqldb to mysql on ci ? XEM is released with mysql but it's supposed to use hsqldb for integration tests on ci  
09:01 <vmassol> not me...  
09:02 <+tmortagne> on 39.7% on rendering ?  
09:02 <+tmortagne> does not seems much  
09:02 <vmassol> yes  
09:02 <vmassol> that's because  
09:02 <vmassol> they don't count integration tests  
09:02 <vmassol> (ie tests in one module testing another module)  
09:02 <vmassol> only unit tests  
09:02 <+tmortagne> yes but even with that we have a lot of unit tests  
09:02 <+tmortagne> ha  
09:02 <vmassol> not that much  
09:02 <+tmortagne> you mean rendering-integration-test is not counted ?  
09:03 <vmassol> yep  
09:03 <+tmortagne> ouch indeed since that's what makes most of the tests  
09:03 <vmassol> they have a new plugin for counting that  
09:03 <vmassol> but it's not activated on nemo apparently  
09:03 <vmassol> the jacoco plugin  
09:04 <vmassol> there are 11 tests failing btw: http://nemo.sonarsource.org/dashboard/index/207147  
09:04 <vmassol> probably the crypto/csrf ones  
09:05 <vmassol> ah no  
09:05 <vmassol> some rendering ones  
09:05 <vmassol> (the crypto ones too)  
09:05 <vmassol> http://nemo.sonarsource.org/drilldown/measures/207147?metric=test\_success\_density  
09:08 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
09:14 <+tmortagne> vmassol: they are not big fans of "fix for" on Jenkins: http://issues.jenkins-ci.org/browse/JENKINS-4988 :)  
09:16 <mayanks431> has joined #xwiki  
09:16 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
09:17 <mayanks43> has quit  
09:21 <vmassol> right....  
09:21 <vmassol> 5 jan 2011  
09:21 <vmassol> it's recent  
09:22 <vmassol> I'll ask arnaud  
09:22 <+tmortagne> ok  
09:23 <+tmortagne> I think i remember him saying on lescastcodeurs that is was ok (or maybe it was in process)  
09:24 <vmassol> I've asked on twitter  
09:25 <+tmortagne> s/process/progress/  
09:25 <vmassol> tmortagne: could you check http://nemo.sonarsource.org/dashboard/index/207147 's failing tests for the rendering. Are they working on trunk?  
09:25 <vmassol> their build was done on 24th of march  
09:26 <vmassol> could it have been done while you had not finished your refactorings?  
09:26 <+tmortagne> vmassol: our ci seems ok (not i'm not working on trunk right now)  
09:26 <+tmortagne> checking  
09:27 <vmassol> Version 3.1-SNAPSHOT - Thu, 24 Mar 2011 14:53:07  
09:27 <vmassol> Version 3.1-SNAPSHOT - Thu, 24 Mar 2011 14:53:07 +000 to be precise  
09:27 <+tmortagne> weird I don't remember tests like http://nemo.sonarsource.org/drilldown/measures/207147?metric=test\_failures&rids[]=215649&rids[]=314048# failing  
09:28 <vmassol> the pb is " Nested scripts are not allowed"  
09:28 <vmassol> (for all rendering tests failing)  
09:28 <+tmortagne> does not seems caused by project refactoring stuff  
09:28 <vmassol> (at least all i checked)  
09:29 <+tmortagne> should be things like, impossible to find some component or something  
09:31 <+tmortagne> checking my commits but I think I was not all done with refactoring on Thu, 24 Mar 2011 14:53:07  
09:32 <+tmortagne> actually yes it was done, i did not more things after but not about fixing stuff, just more refactoring  
09:32 <+tmortagne> s/not/some/  
09:34 <+sburjan> good morning  
09:34 <+sburjan> I have a question  
09:34 <+sburjan> what should I test today, RC1, or latest 3.0 snapshot ?  
09:35 <+tmortagne> vmassol: also there is not much difference between macrogroovy2.test which is working and macrogroovy3.test which is failing here, the only difference is one have empty content  
09:35 <+tmortagne> so for now I'm a bit confused on what could cause that  
09:36 <+tmortagne> sburjan: RC1  
09:36 <+tmortagne> no  
09:36 <+tmortagne> snapshot sorry  
09:36 <+sburjan> ok  
09:36 <+tmortagne> missread  
09:36 <+tmortagne> i tough you saif 3.1-SNAPSHOT :)  
09:36 <+sburjan> no no, that's another story :)  
09:36 <+tmortagne> some bugfixes has been committed between RC1 and the current 3.0 snapshot  
09:37 <+sburjan> okay. I will download latest snapshot (from yesterday)  
09:43 <vmassol> tmortagne: from arnaud: "@vmassol 75% of my jobs are in #mvn3 with #jenkins . Only 1 annoying bug opened but it occurs only in sonar jobs: http://tinyurl.com/4qwb3gw"  
09:44 <vmassol> IMO we really need more agents  
09:45 <vmassol> and simply have one on mvn3  
09:45 <vmassol> we need to talk to infra  
09:49 <arkub> has joined #xwiki  
09:58 <+sburjan> :)  
09:59 <+sburjan> we want to switch to mvn3 ?  
10:29 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki

10:38 <jstoldt> has quit  
10:40 <jstoldt|Notebook> has joined #xwiki  
10:40 <vmassol> cjdelisle: good morning  
10:40 <vmassol> I've tried again filesystem storage for attachments  
10:40 <vmassol> and it has worked well :)  
10:40 <vmassol> I uploaded a 550MB file  
10:52 <+sburjan> vmassol: should I be allowed to insert a macro in comments ?  
10:52 <vmassol> sburjan: yes but....  
10:52 <vmassol> in some future we might need to disallow some macros to be used  
10:53 <vmassol> like scirpting macros and html macro  
10:53 <+sburjan> yepp  
10:53 <vmassol> but we certainmy want  
10:53 <+sburjan> I was able to insert a warning macro as comment, and it works :)  
10:53 <vmassol> users to be able to us ethe code macro for ex  
10:54 <+sburjan> yepp, that's good  
10:56 <kasun> has quit  
11:06 <+sburjan> sdumitriu: hello;  
11:06 <@sdumitriu> Hi sburjan  
11:07 <+sburjan> sdumitriu: what do you think about changing the "Followed users" text in "Following users" ?  
11:07 <+sburjan> from User Profile  
11:07 <@sdumitriu> IMO, Following = they are following me  
11:07 <@sdumitriu> Which is not the same  
11:07 <@sdumitriu> But I agree that "folowed" is not the best term  
11:07 <+sburjan> twitter uses Following/Followers  
11:08 <@sdumitriu> An idea would be to mix both followed and following, and rename it to "People in my network" or something like that  
11:08 <+sburjan> "Followed users" takes me to thinking of past tense  
11:11 <vmassol> mflorea: it's time to start the final release preparation! :)  
11:11 <vmassol> mflorea: is the RC1 release all done?  
11:12 <+mflorea> vmassol: not yet, finishing the release notes  
11:12 <+mflorea> wdym by "final release preparation"?  
11:12 <vmassol> (ok, re the final we should wait monday probably to get some feedback but it means we'll release it only around wednesday I guess)  
11:12 <vmassol> what I mean is that usually need 2-3 days  
11:12 <vmassol> to perform a release  
11:13 <vmassol> so if the release date is N  
11:13 <vmassol> then you need to start the release at N-2 or N-3  
11:13 <vmassol> releaase date = date at which the version is released != date at which the release process starts :)  
11:13 <vmassol> ideally  
11:14 <vmassol> our release process should only take 1-2 hours but in practice there are tests to stabilize, etc  
11:14 <+mflorea> well, normally it takes at most half a day to perform the maven part of the release and around a day to finish the paper works. What takes the most is fixing tests before the release  
11:14 <vmassol> yep  
11:14 <vmassol> that's an issue we need to collevtiely solve  
11:14 <+sburjan> and testing should I gess it must be done before (N-3) - 3 :D  
11:14 <vmassol> it shouldn't be the role of the RM to do that  
11:14 <vmassol> (and it isn't)  
11:24 <vmassol> sdumitriu: are you fixing the bug with chrome on home page for the final? (the image that overlaps with the select box)  
11:24 <vmassol> (would be good if you can since it's very visible on the home page)  
11:25 <vmassol> (I demoed it yesterday to someone and he noticed the problem too)  
11:25 <vmassol> (on his own machine)  
11:26 <@sdumitriu> Yes

11:56 <jvelociter> or not  
11:56 <jvelociter> :)  
12:09 <sburjan> has quit  
12:22 <abusenius\_> has joined #xwiki  
12:24 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
12:28 <jstoldt|Notebook> good morning! :) is it likely that somebody is going to be here on the weekend?  
12:29 <@sdumitriu> Yes  
12:29 <jvelociter> yes  
12:29 <@sdumitriu> Not as many, but some are  
12:30 <jstoldt|Notebook> great. because i have to stall all work for today but might proceed tomorrow or so  
12:30 <jstoldt|Notebook> being a student is hard!  
12:32 <+evalica> jstoldt|Notebook: did you checked out our GSOC projects? still being a student ... just an idea  
12:33 <jstoldt|Notebook> well, sort of...  
12:33 <jstoldt|Notebook> but i really won't have the time, i expect  
12:33 <@sdumitriu> jstoldt|Notebook is not interested in becoming a geek  
12:33 <jstoldt|Notebook> wow, that's so not it... already being a geek  
12:33 <jstoldt|Notebook> i just try to not get a full blown geek! ;)  
12:34 <jstoldt|Notebook> but seriously, i am taking two topics extra next semester, want to start working my university and have to write some papers for my studies so i just expect i won't have enough time  
12:36 <+evalica> anyway it's great that you already contribute to an open source project ... so it's up to you to find the balance - good luck with your topics  
12:37 <jstoldt|Notebook> thanks. well, i am contributing to other open source software for a number of years now, so that's actually also a factor in all this  
13:03 <abusenius\_> has quit  
13:09 <mflorea> has quit  
13:42 <mayanks43> has left #xwiki  
14:07 <bbc581> has joined #xwiki  
14:24 <+tmortagne> sburjan: i don't understand http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-6180, looks like you are talking about wiki macro and not groovy macro  
14:26 <+tmortagne> the fact that your wiki macro contains groovy has nothing to do with the fact that it's registered or not  
14:27 <bbc581> has quit  
14:27 <bbc581> has joined #xwiki  
14:28 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
14:31 <+sburjan> tmortagne: I know. It's wiki macro, but I didn't how to write it. You can change its title as you consider fit. The Macro is actually a XWikiMacro class with groovy source code in it.  
14:33 <+tmortagne> sburjan: i changed the description, tall me if there is something wrong  
14:33 <+tmortagne> s/tall/tell/  
14:33 <+tmortagne> you should also indicate what sdumitriu asked (the visibility you set) because PR is  not needed for macros unless it's a global macro  
14:34 <@sdumitriu> I didn't ask, I said  
14:34 <+sburjan> tmortagne: yes, should I mention this is a global macro ?  
14:35 <+sburjan> but I see sdumitriu mentioned that  
14:35 <+tmortagne> sdumitriu: was not sure to me given sburjan description that he registered it as global  
14:35 <bbc5812> has joined #xwiki  
14:35 <bbc581> has quit  
14:36 <+tmortagne> sburjan: yes better mentioning it explicitely  
14:36 <bbc5812> has quit  
14:36 <+sburjan> tmortagne: okay.  
14:48 <sburjan> has quit  
14:48 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
14:58 <+sburjan> tmortagne: any chance PR to be dropped upon restarting the farm ?  
14:59 <cjdelisle> hey, good idea.  
14:59 <+tmortagne> sburjan: hope not or we would have a lot more issue that this  
14:59 <+tmortagne> \*than  
15:07 <vmassol> want to try using JDK 7: http://blogs.jetbrains.com/idea/2011/03/start-using-java-7-with-intellij-idea-105-eap/?utm\_source=feedburner&utm\_medium=feed&utm\_campaign=Feed%3A+jetbrains\_intellijidea+%28JetBrains+IntelliJ+IDEA+Blog%29  
15:11 <+sburjan> is Java 7 already out ?  
15:11 <@sdumitriu> No  
15:11 <@sdumitriu> Beta  
15:11 <+sburjan> they're surely not sleeping  
15:16 <tmortagne> has quit  
15:18 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
15:18 <vmassol> tmortagne: "@vmassol fix for 1.392 (jira issue updated)"  
15:18 <vmassol> for the jira issue you mentioned today (jenkins)  
15:18 <vmassol> http://issues.jenkins-ci.org/browse/JENKINS-4988?focusedCommentId=147165&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-147165  
15:18 <+tmortagne> vmassol: ok cool then we have it  
15:19 <vmassol> and for buildnumebr plugins with git:  
15:19 <vmassol> "@aheritier @vmassol for buildnumber plugin with git and testing it see snapshots repos to declare here http://bit.ly/gVWO26"  
15:20 <+tmortagne> another good news  
15:22 <vmassol> apparently the enforcer plugin doesn't work in 3.0.3 according to olivier lamy  
15:23 <vmassol> to be verified  
15:23 <vmassol> (for forcing plugin versions)  
15:31 <cjdelisle> Any thoughts about applying the patch for XWIKI-6169 to 3.0 (I understand an RC2 is going to happen), it seems pretty safe to me and it will solve an incoherency issue (although it is an unlikely case)  
15:31 <vmassol> cjdelisle: there's no RC2 AFAIK  
15:31 <vmassol> unless I missed something earlier today when out for lunch… hope not :)  
15:32 <+tmortagne> vmassol: there has been some bugfixing but don't think we decided if there would be RC2 or not yet  
15:32 <vmassol> cjdelisle: I think you should wait for 3.0.1 or 3.1M1  
15:32 <vmassol> tmortagne: well we did decide no RC2  
15:32 <vmassol> by default there's never a RC2  
15:32 <vmassol> unless we find a blocking bug that requires it  
15:32 <@sdumitriu> +1 for postponing the issue  
15:33 <@sdumitriu> It's kind of short notice at the moment, and with pretty big impact  
15:33 <+tmortagne> vmassol: I know unless some blocker bug is found and i fixed copy document unusable in multiwiki  
15:33 <vmassol> but yes we've slipped by allowing changes in final  
15:33 <+tmortagne> which is pretty blocker  
15:33 <vmassol> which theoretically we shoudn't allow  
15:33 <vmassol> so we could say that RC2 is the final indeed if we want  
15:33 <vmassol> it's just one extra version to release  
15:33 <+tmortagne> but iabout cjdelisle patch I think it can wait it's not it was a regression i think  
15:34 <vmassol> not sure marius will like that ;)  
15:34 <cjdelisle> Ok. I thought that specific one was pretty safe but that's fine with me.  
15:35 <vmassol> cjdelisle: hmmm something strange  
15:35 <vmassol> it seems that my home page loads very slowly now that I've added a large attachment to it  
15:35 <vmassol> could that be possible?  
15:35 <cjdelisle> It makes no sense to me.  
15:35 <vmassol> ok must be something else  
15:36 <vmassol> must be the AS which is slowing it down  
15:36 <vmassol> just that I didn't notice before adding that 550MB attachment  
15:36 <cjdelisle> The attachment is never in ram so it should never be able to have an effect.  
15:36 <vmassol> ok  
15:36 <+tmortagne> vmassol: if you just attached it maybe it's lucene processing it  
15:36 <kasun> has joined #xwiki  
15:36 <vmassol> cjdelisle: is it normal that it's very slow to delete?  
15:37 <cjdelisle> Yes because it needs to copy it into the "recycle bin"  
15:37 <vmassol> tmortagne: I attached it 2 hours ago so should be something else  
15:37 <+tmortagne> ok  
15:37 <vmassol> cjdelisle: ok....  
15:37 <vmassol> some work for improvement later on  
15:37 <vmassol> moving files around instead of copying  
15:38 <cjdelisle> Because the recycle bin and the attachment store are seperate modules, the only safe solution is to stream the attachment into a new file then delete the old one.  
15:39 <@sdumitriu> Why, I think that's very decent  
15:39 <cjdelisle> Bad performance  
15:39 <vmassol> it's slow  
15:40 <@sdumitriu> Yes, good modularity  
15:40 <vmassol> from a tech pov it's logical  
15:40 <@sdumitriu> Maybe it could be done in a background thread  
15:40 <vmassol> from a user pov it could be faster  
15:40 <@sdumitriu> But that means concurrency issues, like the attachment is there, but it isn't quite yet  
15:41 <vmassol> question:  
15:41 <vmassol> if I rollback the deletion of an attachment  
15:41 <vmassol> should it create a new rev of that attachment ?  
15:42 <vmassol> (is that correct behavior)  
15:42 <@sdumitriu> Rollback how?  
15:42 <@sdumitriu> From the document history?  
15:42 <vmassol> yes  
15:42 <@sdumitriu> Well, it's not quite the ideal behavior  
15:42 <cjdelisle> I don't actually know but it sounds like it should be a storage test.  
15:43 <@sdumitriu> So I'd say no, if possible  
15:43 <vmassol> cjdelisle: that's the behavior happenig with file storage, don't know about default non FS behavior though  
15:44 <cjdelisle> Adding it to storage-tests now.  
15:48 <vmassol> tmortagne: shouldn't we remove components.txt in commons-test?  
15:48 <vmassol> actually component-overrides  
15:48 <vmassol> I'm not sure where it was needed exactly but it doesn't sound right  
15:49 <+tmortagne> vmassol: no idea, looking what is in it  
15:50 <vmassol> it's forcing to use components from rendering-xwiki  
15:50 <vmassol> instead of the default ones  
15:51 <+tmortagne> since it's rendering and xwiki specific stuff yes it's very wrong  
15:51 <+tmortagne> it has nothingg to do here
